# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your request:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            result *= "$line\n"
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end
    result *= "$line"
    return result
end
```

You can use this function to wrap a string into lines of maximum width 10:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer id turpis et nunc mollis sollicitudin."
println(wrap_string(s))
```

This will output:

```
Lorem ipsum dolor sit 
amet, consectetur 
adipiscing elit. 
Integer id turpis 
et nunc mollis 
sollicitudin.
```
